lines.text: Who is that charming girl?
No one seems to know. She is stunning isn't she?
A vision. Why, if I were young man I'd.
[pause]
Yes, dear?
Well, I'd be younger, wouldn't I?
Yes, dear.
Beauty knows no pain, girls!
I doubt he has any idea how a girl should be treated.
Like a princess, I suppose.
No, like a person, with kindness and respect.

But the world is full of zanies and fools / Who don't believe in sensible rules/ And won't believe what sensible people say / And because these daft and dewey-eyed dopes / Keep building up impossible hopes / Impossible / Things are happening everyday

The sweetest sounds I'll ever hear are still inside my head / The kindest words I'll ever know are waiting to be said / The most entrancing sight of all is yet for me to see / And the dearest love in all the world is waiting somewhere for me / Is waiting somewhere, somewhere for me.

[singing]
Am I making believe I see in you a man too perfect to be really true? Do I want you because you're wonderful? Or are you wonderful because I want you?
My girls are going to be the envy of everyone at the ball.
I've always been told I've got too big a heart.
You've got too big a heart, Mother.
Don't cling to the past Cinderella. It's not very attractive.
Are there any other young women in the house?

[speaking in high-pitched voice]
How young?
Younger than you.
But shouldn't a man love you for who you are, in spite of everything?
How quaint. Tell me, Cinderella, What would you say to capture the prince?
I don't know. But whatever I'd say, we'd know in an instant we were meant for each other. Then he'd smile, and kiss my hand.
That's so romantic.
Oh, say it again, Cinderella.
Rubbish! This isn't about love, it's about marriage.
So many beautiful girls! He'll meet someone tonight.
And if he doesn't?
This ball will never end!
I don't think we ordered enough food.
We're just planning a little get together, nothing fancy. Just family, a few close friends and all the eligible young women in the kingdom.
Mother.
We're only talking four or five hundred at the most.
Did you ever see such a lazy girl in your life?
Who are you calling lazy?
Not you, stupid, Cinderella!
Oh. Who are you calling stupid?

[singing]
Why would a fella want a girl like her? / A frail and fluffy beauty? / Why can't a fella ever once prefer / a solid gal like me!
She's a frothy little bubble / with a flimsy kind of charm / and with very little trouble / I could break her little arm!

Impossible! / For a plain yellow pumpkin to become a golden carriage / Impossible! / For a plain country bumpkin and a prince to join in marriage!/ The world is full of zanies and fools who don't believe in sensible rules.
You know, I honestly wish there was something between us.
Really?
Yes. A continent.
[walks away]
If he wants to kill me, why doesn't he just run me over with his carriage and get it over with?
Why? Why is this so hard for you to imagine?

Because you're common, Cinderella. Your mother was common and so are you. Only you can wash your face and put on a clean dress, but underneath, you'll still be common. But a prince would even consider taking you for his bride? Why, it's laughable!
My father.
Your father was weak. He spoiled you rotten, he filled your head with silly thoughts and dreams that'll never come true. Never. Now, clean this place up. It's a sty.
Cinderella, if you really love him, why don't you let him know?
How can I? Look at me.
Do you really think he fell in love with your fancy gown and your pretty braids?
I don't know anymore and if you hadn't help me.
You didn't need my help. You just thought you did. Believe in yourself, Cinderella, and trust him to love you as you really are.
The Prince is Giving A Ball. His royal highness Christopher Rupert son of her majesty Queen Constantina Charlotte Hermantrude Guenivere Mazie.
Mazie?
Mazie. Marguerite Anne is giving a ball.
The Prince is Giving A Ball.
Go to the ball? Me? Why would I wanna go to the ball? I'd much rather sit here by the fire.
His royal highness Christopher Rupert son of his majesty King Maximillian Godfee Ladeslous Leapolt Sydney.

[speaking in unison]
Sydney?
Sydney. Fredrick John is giving a ball.
Was it last summer at the lake?
No, I can't swim.

[after Fairy Godmother turns the pumpkin into a carriage]
Oh my goodness.
Don't worry your majesties he'll meet someone tonight. I can feel it in my bones.
You'll feel it in your bones if he doesn't.
[hits Lionel while he's standing on the ladder]
[screams as he falls off of the ladder]

[the Prince dances with another girl]
I want a chance at him!
His royal highness, Christoper Rupert, Windimir, Vladimir, Carl, Alexander, Francois, Reginald, Lancelot, Herman.
Herman?
Herman. Gregory James! He'll thank us for it later, is giving a ball!

[singing]
Falling in love with love is falling for make-believe/Falling in love with love is playing the fool/Caring too much is such a juvenile fancy/Learning to trust is just for children in school/I fell in love with love one night when the moon was full/I was unwise with eyes unable to see/I fell in love with love with love everlasting/And love fell out with me!

Impossible, for a plain yellow pumpkin to become a golden carriage/Impossible for a plain country pumpkin and a prince to join in marriage. A slipper made of glass is just a shoe and dreamers never make the dream come true. Impossible.
But those three are all I've got. Before my father died I promised him that we'd stay together as a family.
Cinderella this can't be what your daddy had in mind for you baby.
Chris you've been up all night. Come have something to eat.
I can't. I can't eat or rest until I've found her again.
NOOOO!
Quiet, Woman.
